bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 10, 1900

div1.p: Lazear details his plan to return to the United States for a visit. He also discusses improvements to his quarters.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 10, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad
to hear that you had
been in to see Mabel.
She seems very anxious
to go out to Beverly
with you. Can she
be accommodated there
all night? It would
be a good place for
her.

It is early to plan
about my visit. I
should like to be in
New York for a few
days and also in
Baltimore. My whole
stay must be very
short and there is
lots of work to be
done here.

They have promised
to repair our quarters
giving up a bath room
and ceilings, at present
there is only a roof.

Thank you for the
Bookman. It come today
but I have not yet looked
at it. I always enjoy them.

I frequently go down to the ocean
in the late afternoon and have
a swim. The beach is good
and the water very nice.

There are always a number of
people from the post down
there at that time.

Dear little Houston must have
been quite a trouble to you this
summer you had him longer
than you bargained for.
